node.title: Why Western Australia has less problem gamblers than the rest of the country
node.alt: Gaming machines inside Crown Perth's Pearl Room, with gaming tables and casino staff in the background.
node.description: Western Australia has the highest proportion of gamblers in the country but a lower level of problem gambling. Here's why.Â
node.content:
["Western Australia has the highest proportion of gamblers in the country but a lower level of problem gambling \u2014 because it has fewer electronic gaming machines.", "That's the finding of an expert report ordered by the Perth Casino Royal Commission.", "The report by a team of CQUniversity gambling researchers, led by Matthew Rockloff, also found there was \"no good evidence\" the Electronic Gaming Machines (EGMs) played at Crown Perth were safer for problem gamblers than the EGMs, or pokies, played in other states.", "Pokies have been banned by law in WA since the Crown Perth casino opened in 1985 and EGMs are only allowed to be played at the casino.\u00a0", "
All gaming machines\u00a0'inherently dangerous',\u00a0says report
", "But the royal commission has heard from many witnesses who have struggled to explain the exact difference between an illegal poker machine and a legal EGM approved by the casino watchdog.", "", "
Questions were raised during the Royal Commission\u00a0about whether there is much difference between poker machines and EGMs.(ABC News: Giulio Saggin)
", "The CQUniversity report said all EGMs were \"inherently dangerous\" because of the potential for gamblers to overspend and become addicted.", "\"...there appears to be no evidence that the EGMs in WA are safer based on the machines themselves,\" it said.", "", "
Almost two thirds of West Australians love a bet, but their gambling\u00a0is less likely to spiral out of control.\u00a0(ABC: supplied)
", "Data published in the report showed that about 63 per cent of Western Australians gamble, compared to about 56 per cent in the rest of Australia.", "But of these, only 0.9 per cent of WA gamblers were problem gamblers, compared to 2.3 per cent in other states and territories.\u00a0", "Only 8.7 per cent of WA gamblers played EGMs, compared to 17.3 per cent elsewhere.", "\"...the fact that WA experiences fewer gambling problems can only be explained by the fact that fewer people in WA gamble on EGMs,\" it said.", "The report said it would be reasonable to conclude that if WA had more EGMs, the number of problem gamblers would increase.", "\"In fact, our analyses \u2026 suggest that people who play EGMs in WA are just as likely to have gambling problems as people who play EGMs elsewhere.\""]
